description: A variant spelling of extraverted. Popularized as a psychological term by Phyllis Blanchard's use of extrovert in her 1918 "Psycho-Analytic Study of August Comte".

adjectives.description: extroverted (comparative more extroverted, superlative most extroverted)

entries.meaning: (informal psychology) Of or characteristic of the personality of an extrovert: outgoing, sociable.
examples: She's very extroverted. She's always out meeting new people and looking for new experiences.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of extrovert
